FEMALE EMPLOYED ON PIECE RATE BASIS

: () (i) , (ii) , ? () 2001 29 27/2001 2001 12 ? () 25 14 ? () (i) 10 , (ii) , ? () 14 ? () , ? asked the Prime Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order, (a) Will he inform this House (i) the date on which the female employees who are employed on the basis of piece rate payment in the Auditor Generals Department were recruited; (ii) the total number of such employees and their names separately? (b) Is he aware that a qualifing test has been conducted to check their qualifications as per a letter dated 12th November 2001, in order to confirm them in service in terms of the Public Administration Circular bearing No. 27/2001 and dated 29th October 2001? (c) Will he state the reasons for confirming only 25 persons out of them and for not confirming the remaining 14 persons on the results of the aforesaid qualifying test?

(d) Will he admit that,- (i) the non-confirmation of these persons who have gained and experience after serving for a period of nearly 10 years for a low salary is an injustice; (ii) undervaluation of them before the freshes who passes higher educational qualification and high computer literacy by conducting competitive tests is an injustice. (e) Will he take action to confirm in service the remaining 14 female employees who have been subjected to the aforesaid injustice? (f) If not, why?
( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) , , , , . ? ? ( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) .
- 2002 - 2002 EXAMINATION FOR RECRUITMENT OF CLERKS IN GOVERNMENT OFFICES - 2002 0625/06 2.

() , ? () (i) , (ii) 2002 , ? () , ? asked the Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs : (a) Will he inform this House, - (i) the number of applicants who have sat for the examination for the recruitment of clerks in government offices, held in 2002, and, (ii) the number of persons who passed that examination? (b) Will he state in this House, the names, addresses and the respective marks of those who have passed, according to the priority list separately? (c) Will he state,- (i) the list of names of those who have been given employment as per the said lsit and the instiutions they were recruited to : (ii) will he state whether appointments would be given to all those remaining candidates who have passed the examination in 2002? (d) If not why?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Chandrasiri GajadeeraMinister of Home Affairs) , . () (i) 260,000. (ii) 11,750. () . I * . () (i) II * . (ii) .

( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) , 45 (1) - () - : determine the assignment of subjects and functions to, and the Ministries, .. What are the subjects ?
( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) . . ( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayaka) ?

( - ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe - Leader of the Opposition) Hon. Speaker, Article 46(1) of the Constitution, 46(1) . . . 46. (1) The President may, from time to time in consultation with the Prime Minister, where he considers such consultation to be necessary, appoint from among the Members of Parliament, Deputy Ministers to assist the Ministers of the Cabinet of Ministers in the performance of their duties.

. . 45(1) . . 45. (1) The President may, from time to time, in consultation with the Prime Minister where he considers such consultation to be necessary - (b) determine the assignment of subjects and functions to, and the Ministries, if any, which are to be in charge of, such Ministers.

That means, in regard to Ministers who are not Members of the Cabinet, their functions have to be determined and gazetted. Now, when we had Ministers outside the Cabinet, we had always stated to assist the Cabinet Minister. But if he was a Minister outside the Cabinet for which portfolio there was no Cabinet Minister, then he had the functions for himself. For instance, Mr. Johnston Fernando was Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports a non-Cabinet Minister. He had no function of assisting any Ministers. But Ministers - I could give examples - like the Hon. Lakshman Senewiratne who was a non-Cabinet Minister assisted the then Minister of Irrigation and Water Management. So if the President has left this function out, the President has not recognized that Minister. All we can do in this House is to recognize him. If the Minister is not there, then the Chief Government Whip must answer. I mean, we are only going by the Constitution which we have to uphold.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, I am Speaking on behalf of not only the non-Cabinet Minister who was referred to this moment, but the other 36 Ministers also who are jobless today. They are jobless, they are officeless, they are secretaryless and they are penniless. . . . . . duty free -
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) , . Sir, we want an Order. -
( . . - ) (The Hon. A. D. Susila Premajayantha - Minister of Education) -
( . . ) (The Hon. A. D. Susila Premajayantha) , 45 (3) . . . (3) Every Minister appointed under this Article shall be responsible and answerable to the Cabinet of Ministers and to Parliament.

. . ( . . ) (The Hon. A. D. Susil Premajayantha) , 45 (4) . Any Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers may, by Notification . Shall may [ ] , [ ] . ( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe) , . 45 (3) . Every Minister appointed under this Article shall be responsible and answerable to the Cabinet of Ministers and to Parliament. , . Speaker, I will refer to the same Article referred to by the Hon. Leader of the Opposition. [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe) . ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . [ ] . . ( . . ) (The Hon. A. D. Susil Premajayantha) Article 45(3) states : Every Minister appointed under this Article shall be responsible and answerable to the Cabinet of Ministers and
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) And what ? And whom ?

( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe) In Article 46 there is no similar provision. . . ( . . ) (The Hon. A. D. Susil Premajayantha) Do not refer to Article 46. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Do not read it in abstract. . . ( . . ) (The Hon. A. D. Susil Premajayantha) Article 46 refers to Deputy Minister. ( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickramasinghe) Hon. Speaker, I draw your attention to Article 53 of the Constitution. It states I quote: A person appointed to any office referred to in this Chapter shall not enter upon the duties of his office until he takes and subscribes the oath or makes and subscribes the affirmation set out in the Fourth Schedule. In addition to that he must take the Seventh Schedule oath not to divide the country also.

, . , ' ' ' ' . ' ' . , ' ' . . - ( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Rauff HakeemMinister of Posts and Telecommunication) Hon. Speaker, I rise to a point of Order. ( ) (Mr. Speaker) - [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) The hon. Members of the Tamil National Alliance are highly agitated because they have not seen the amendment that has been left on the table. There is an amendment to the title of the Bill that the Government is moving. That will be moved at the Committee Stage. That has already been placed and that has been Tamilised as

. There will not be the use of the title "Jathika Saviya Authority". That is what the Hon. Minister is now proposing. Actually they are getting agitated over the name Jathika Saviya . This name is going to be dropped and that amendment will be moved at the Committee Stage. ( ) (An hon. Member) We can take it up at the Committee Stage. - [Interruption.] . ( . ) (The Hon. Mavai S. Senathirajah) In that also they say Jathika Saviya. There is no other paper here. ( ) (The Hon. Risad Badhiutheen ) ' ' ' ' . [] . , , , ,

I move, in page 6, line 15, at end add : (o) to ensure a conducive physical environment for resettlement, by clearing land mines and debris and repairing the damaged infrastructure. , . . Amendment put, and agreed to.. 14 , , .
